content.description: Fun face climbing up good edges
content.location: If facing crocodile rock head left and up into a narrow corridor, right side route.

content.description: Climb to the single bolt (5.8+). Make the crux moves up the slab straight above/slightly right of the bolt, to a short thin crack (small cam) about 15 feet above. Move up and finish through the plates above. Finishes at the same location as Competitive Edge.
content.protection: small cams and nuts, one bolt. Larger pieces (#2, #3) for the anchor.
content.location: Just to the right of Competitive Edge, look for a single bolt about 30 feet up on the slab.
If facing crocodile rock head left and up into a narrow corridor, left route.

climbs.name: Competitive Edge
climbs.fa: Grant Hiskes, Ken Yager, Sean Plunkett, 1983

content.description: Great thin crack to cool plates. Nice ledge and crack for anchor at 105' (if you're toproping), but must do short second pitch to get to 3rd/4th walk-off.
content.location: The clean thin crack to plates in the middle of the face.

climbs.name: Challenger
climbs.fa: Steve Schneider,  Kevin Calder, Errett Allen

content.description: Great face climbing with mostly great gear. Almost as good as it's neighbors to the right, Competitive Edge and King Snake, though a bit more exciting. Fairly straightforward and enjoyable climbing to the mini roof then game on. Protection at the roof seems adequate but less than perfect and adds to the committing feeling of getting to the bolt above. Thanks to whom ever replaced the bolt with a new fatty.  I was surprised and quite happy to find such a confidence inspiring bolt due to the nature of the rock below and the not so straight forward climbing above. Work out the moves above the bolt that will eventually lead to a positive hold, take a deep breath and continue on easier ground to a stance and gear above. From here, it's fun and run plate climbing to the ledge above. A traverse left ( do not forget about the 2nd) will get you to anchor possibilities.
content.protection: What you and I carry and  place on a route like this will surely be different. This is not Yosemite granite so I tend to take em when I get em and back them up. I also tend to carry and place a lot of Tricams which most won't have. I placed 1 blue Metolius through 1 #3 BD, several stoppers and Tricams. Runners were nice to have. I used my #s 1-3C4s  on route so was happy to have my med size Tricams at the anchor you may want   at 1 and 2 C4 size for yours.
content.location:
This route  starts to the left of Competitive Edge ​

https://www.mountainproject.com/route/105899350/competitive-edge

​​​ . It is about in the middle of the cliff below an obvious downward pointed roof.

content.description: More or less straight up crack climb.  There are other routes to the left (Slither) and right (Poacher and Challenger) of this route, but this is the only route on the cliff which looks 5.7.
content.protection: Gear to 3", doubles useful because you have to build a gear anchor.
content.location: Towards the left side of Crocodile Rock.  Descend to climber's left down a 3rd class gully.
